info.title: Zoho CRM REST APIs
info.description:
The Zoho CRM Developers workspace represents Collections curated by the CRM Developer Relations team.

To find out more about the Zoho CRM APIs:

- Visit our [developer documentation](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v4/).
- Check out our sample code on [GitHub](https://github.com/zoho).
- Talk to us about the APIs in our [developer forum](https://help.zoho.com/portal/en/community/zoho-crm/zoho-crm-developer).
- Write to us at [support@zohocrm.com](mailto:support@zohocrm.com) if you have any questions or suggestions.

To retrieve the users' data specified in the API request. You can specify the type of users that needs to be retrieved using the Users API. For example, use type=AllUsers, to get the list of all the CRM users available.

Refer to [help doc](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v4/get-users.html) to know more.

get.description:
User type is a label for the users who will be accessing the CRM modules via portal. You can configure permissions for the user types that will enable or restrict access to the data in the CRM account. Some examples of portal user types are vendors, clients, consultants, customers, partners, or resellers.

Use this API to get the user types available in a portal of your org.

tags.name: V4
tags.description: The folder contains collection of Zoho CRMs v4 APIs. Please refer to the [documentation](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v4/) for detailed information on v4 APIs.

tags.name: Modules
tags.description: Zoho CRM has standard modules such as, Leads, Accounts, Contacts, Deals, Products, Activities, etc,.

tags.name: Organization
tags.description: To get your organization's data.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
In Zoho CRM, users access and manage the records. You can define these users under various profiles and categories such as Administrators, Standard, etc,.

Use the Users APIs to retrieve the basic information of your available CRM users. Use the "type" parameter to get the required list of users. For example, the value "admin" for this param gets the list of CRM users with the Administrative profile.

tags.name: Records
tags.description: A record is an entity which stores all the combined information of a particular contact or company, which is acquired from various sources. The information may be acquired from a web-form, social media services, advertisements etc. The records API allows the user to get, create, update, delete, or search records.

tags.name: Get Records
tags.description: A record is an entity which stores all the combined information of a particular contact or company, which is acquired from various sources. The information may be acquired from a web-form, social media services, advertisements etc. The records API allows the user to get, create, update, delete, or search records.

tags.name: Insert Records
tags.description: To add new entities to a module.

tags.name: Update Records
tags.description: To update existing entities in the module.

tags.name: Upsert Records
tags.description: To add new entities to a module.

tags.name: Delete Specific Records
tags.description: To delete entities or records from a module.

tags.name: Delete Records
tags.description: To delete entities or records from a module.

tags.name: Mass Convert Lead
tags.description: Convert a maximum of up to 50 leads in a single API call. You can convert a lead with or without creating a deal through this API.

tags.name: Get Deleted Records
tags.description: A record is an entity which stores all the combined information of a particular contact or company, which is acquired from various sources. The information may be acquired from a web-form, social media services, advertisements etc. The records API allows the user to get, create, update, delete, or search records.

tags.name: Search Records
tags.description: To retrieve the records that match your search criteria.

tags.name: Get Record Count in a Module
tags.description: To get the record count in a module.

tags.name: Subform
tags.description:
A subform is a secondary form or a table, which will enable you to include multiple line items into a primary form. They are used to associate multiple items to a single record. On a more technical perspective, subforms easily solve the need for you to establish a one-to-many relationship with data in your CRM, in which many secondary items are associated to a single primary record.  
The Subform API is available only in **Enterprise** and above editions of Zoho CRM. Click [here](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v4/subforms.html) to know more about the Subforms API.

tags.name: Related Lists
tags.description: A record usually contains additional information such as notes, attachments, products, deals, contacts, etc. Using related lists API, you can retrieve all the related list information.

tags.name: Get Related Lists
tags.description: To get the related lists data of different modules. The related lists include Notes, Attachments, Products, Events and more.

tags.name: Leads
tags.description: To get the related list records of the Leads module.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: To get the related list records.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description: To get the related list records.

tags.name: Deals
tags.description: To get the related list details of the Deal records.

tags.name: Campaigns
tags.description: To get the related list of the Campaign records.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: To get the Related Lists associated with Events.

tags.name: Cases
tags.description: To get the related lists associated with Cases.

tags.name: Calls
tags.description: To get the related lists associated with Calls.

tags.name: Solutions
tags.description: To get the related lists associated with Solutions.

tags.name: Products
tags.description: To get the related lists associated with a Product.

tags.name: Vendors
tags.description: To get the Related Lists associated with a Vendor.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description: To get the related lists associated with a Task.

tags.name: Price Books
tags.description: To get the Related Lists associated with a Price Books.

tags.name: Quotes
tags.description: To get the Related Lists associated with a Quote.

tags.name: Sales Orders
tags.description: To get the Related Lists associated with a Sales Order.

tags.name: Purchase Orders
tags.description: To get the Related Lists associated with a Purchase Order.

tags.name: Invoices
tags.description: To get the Related Lists associated with Invoices.

tags.name: Blueprint
tags.description: Zoho CRM's Blueprint is simply an online replica of a business process. It captures every detail of your entire offline process within the software. It facilitates automation, validation, and collaboration of teams, thus making your process more efficient and free from loopholes.

tags.name: Get Blueprint Data
tags.description: To get the next available transitions for that record, fields available for each transitions, current value of each field, and their validation(if any).

tags.name: Update Blueprint
tags.description: To update a single transition at a time. An error is thrown if the record is not in transition, transition_id is wrong, field_value data type mismatches, or field validation fails.

tags.name: Notes
tags.description: Notes provide some additional information about a contact, account, deal or task. You can find the notes section in most of the modules. Hence, with Notes API, you can create, delete, or update notes. You can perform actions on single or multiple notes.

tags.name: Emails
tags.description: Emails are introduced as a related list in Leads, Contacts, Deals, Accounts, Quotes, Invoices, Sales Orders, and Purchase Orders. Use the various APIs available to get the emails of a record, download inline images and attachments, get the sharing details, and associate an email to a record.

tags.name: Contact Roles
tags.description: Contact roles in Zoho CRM define the role of the leads such as Purchasing, Decision Maker, Developer/Evaluator etc, while converted to a deal. Contact roles help you to have more information about who to contact and when.

tags.name: Upload an Attachment
tags.description: To attach a file to a record. You must include the attachment in the request with content type as multipart/form data.

tags.name: Download an Attachment
tags.description: To download a file attached to a record.

tags.name: Delete an Attachment
tags.description: To delete a file attached to a record.

tags.name: Upload a Photo
tags.description: To attach a photo to a record. You must include the photo in the request with content type as multipart/form data.

tags.name: Download a Photo
tags.description: To download the record image of a record in a module.

tags.name: Delete a Photo
tags.description: To delete a photo from a record in a module.

tags.name: Mass Update
tags.description:
The mass update feature allows you to update the values of specific fields for multiple records in territories or custom views in a module. This API is useful when you want to update the same field for all records in a module, territory, or a custom view. In this API, the input contains the API names of the fields whose values you want to update, and the record ids, cvids(custom view IDs), or territory_id. You can update up to 50,000 (fifty thousand) records using this API. Mass update of records happens in two ways:
  • Scheduler type: When you specify custom view ID and territory ID, a job is scheduled in the background and the system returns a "job_id". Use this job_id in the GET request to get the result.
  • Non-scheduler type: When you specify the record IDs, system updates the records instantly. You can update a maximum of 500 records in a single API call in this type of mass update.

tags.name: Mass Update Using CVID and Territory ID
tags.description:
The mass update feature allows you to update the values of specific fields for multiple records in territories or custom views in a module. This API is useful when you want to update the same field for all records in a module, territory, or a custom view.   • Non-scheduler type: When you specify the record IDs, system updates the records instantly. You can update a maximum of 500 records in a single API call in this type of mass update.

tags.description:

  • Non-scheduler type: When you specify the record IDs, system updates the records instantly. You can update a maximum of 500 records in a single API call in this type of mass update.

tags.name: Get Mass Update Status
tags.description: To get the status of the mass update job scheduled previously.

tags.name: Mass Delete
tags.description: Delete the records of a module in bulk. You can delete up to 50,000 records in a custom view or delete up to 500 records using their record IDs in an API call.

tags.name: Currencies
tags.description:
The multi-currency support in Zoho CRM helps you to handle business and transactions in the global market effortlessly. With the multi-currency feature you can:
  • Estimate the value of a deal in your home currency as well as in your customer's local currency
  • Generate and view any report (with figures in other currencies) in your home currency
  • Import reports with figures in multiple currencies

The Administrator of your organization's CRM account must add the home currency and other currencies before other profile users start using them. The system stores the currency specified in input JSON as your home currency. Although you can edit the properties of your home currency, you cannot change it. To know how to update currencies refer to Update Currencies.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: ZFS is the central storage system to all your files and attachments. Use this API to upload fields to ZFS. This API returns an encrypted file ID and the file name. You can use this encrypted ID to attach this file to a file/image upload field or a record in Zoho CRM. You must upload the file with content type as multipart/form data.

tags.name: Share
tags.description: In Zoho CRM, we have different levels of data sharing. One of them is record-level data sharing, where the users can share individual records with other users in the organization. The records can be shared with or without the related lists.

tags.name: Get Shared Record Details
tags.description: To get the details of a shared record.

tags.name: Share Records
tags.description: To share a record with other users in the organization.

tags.name: Update Share Permissions
tags.description:
Using this API, you can:
  • Update the sharing permissions of a record granted to users as Read-Write, Read-only, or grant full access.
  • Revoke access given to users to a shared record.
    • Update the access permission to the related lists of the record that was shared with the user.

tags.name: Revoke Shared Records
tags.description: To revoke access to a shared record that was shared to users.

tags.name: Fields' Attachments
tags.description:
You can upload an image and a file to an image-upload and a file-upload filed, respectively, in a module.

This API downloads the image or file attached to these fields.

tags.name: Change Owner
tags.description: Use this API to change the owner of a record or multiple records.

tags.name: Mass Change Owner
tags.description: Change the owner of the records of a module in a particular custom view and territory in bulk.

tags.name: Meta Data
tags.description: Use these APIs to fetch the metadata for fields, layouts, and related lists for the specified module. It lists the entire fields available and related lists for that module.

tags.name: Profiles
tags.description: Profiles define a set of privileges a user has within Zoho CRM. The administrator gets to decide a user's level of data access. All users need to be assigned to a profile during initialization.

tags.name: Roles
tags.description: In Zoho CRM, roles are issued to users by the Administrator. Usually, roles are meant to denote the different levels of employees in a company. For instance, it can be Managers, Sales Reps, Supervisors, Product Management Staff, etc.

tags.name: Territories
tags.description:
Territory management allows you to automatically associate matching Accounts, Contacts, and Deals with territories to maximize revenue.

Use this API to get the list of territories enabled for your organization.

tags.name: Scoring Rules
tags.description:
Scoring Rules is a system for ranking different records in a module governed by rules that you define based on your specific needs.  
  
With the scoring rules API, you can create, update and delete Scoring rules, get the scoring rules, activate and deactivate scoring rules.

tags.name: CRM Variables
tags.description: A CRM Variable can have unique set of values and can be widely used as merge fields in Email templates, Mail merge templates, and Inventory templates. You can also use them as reusable authentication parameters in APIs.

tags.name: Map Dependency
tags.description:
There are certain fields in a module whose values depend on another field's value. This can be defined as a parent-child relationship. For example, let's say there are two fields - Country and State - in your Leads module. The values in the State field will depend on the country that you select from the Country field. In Zoho CRM, you can define the values that are applicable to a child field based on the parent field's value. This is called mapping dependency fields.

You can now map the picklist values of the dependent field of a child with those of the parent's, via API. You can also get the details of the mapped dependency field, update the picklist values of the child, and delete the dependency, altogether.

tags.name: User Groups APIs
tags.description: You can create different types of groups (set of users) to manage a set of common records. Users associated with a particular group can access the records shared to a particular group and perform the necessary operations on the records

tags.name: Tags
tags.description: Tags are keywords that help you categorize your records based on their characteristics. Tags help you sort your data and find them easily when you need them.

tags.name: Get Tags
tags.description: Tags are keywords that help you categorize your records based on their characteristics. Tags help you sort your data and find them easily when you need them.

tags.name: Add Tags to Records
tags.description: To add tags to records.

tags.name: Remove Tags from Records
tags.description: To delete the tags associated with records.

tags.name: Create Tags
tags.description: To create new tags.

tags.name: Update Tags
tags.description: To update tags.

tags.name: Record Count for a Tag
tags.description: To get the total number of records under a tag.

tags.name: Pipeline
tags.description:
A sales pipeline is a systematic method to navigate between multiple stages through which a sales prospect goes - from becoming a lead to becoming a customer - and a sales pipeline helps you determine where exactly your opportunities are. Besides, it also outlines the actions that you need to perform to convert a prospect into a customer.

Use the Pipeline APIs to get, create, and update a pipeline. You can also transfer the records in a pipeline to another before deleting it.

tags.name: Wizards
tags.description:
A Wizard helps you divide a long form into a series of screens, where users can enter data on each screen as they proceed to the next step until completion. Wizards reduce the chances of errors during data entry as the screens can be partially saved as a draft and submitted later.  
Use the Wizards API to get the details of all the wizards in a module.

tags.name: Assignment Rules
tags.description: Assignment rules allow you to automate the lead assignment process by defining rules based on which leads are assigned to an owner. You can configure different criteria based on your industry's specifications like territory, product interest, lead source etc., such that only the leads that satisfy the criteria will be automatically assigned to a specific owner.

tags.name: Templates
tags.description:
Zoho CRM provides Email Templates to send one message to multiple recipients. You can also use Email templates to send Mass Emails to leads/contacts or send email notifications to the Zoho CRM users upon triggering a workflow rule.

The Inventory template allow you to customize the Quote, Purchase Order, Sales Order, and Invoice print layout as per your business requirements.

The Email and Inventory templates APIs fetch the details of the templates you have created in a module.

tags.name: User's Unavailability
tags.description: Use these APIs to know a user's unavailability before scheduling a meeting or a call, mark yourself unavailable for a specific time period, update and delete your unavailability.

tags.name: Portals
tags.description: Portals in CRM allow the administrators to extend CRM access to their contacts, vendors or partners. A portal user can access the modules and some of the associated data that they have been given access to, such as products, invoices, and notes present in CRM. They can also view, edit, and create records, add notes and attachments.

tags.name: Composite
tags.description: The composite API allows you to combine up to five API calls in a single request consuming just one or two credits per composite call. This API reduces the round-trip time and allows you to execute the APIs in a single database transaction, if needed.

tags.name: Bulk
tags.description: Using the Bulk APIs, you can read/create records in bulk.

tags.name: Bulk Read
tags.description:
Bulk Read API allows you to fetch a large set of data. This API is very useful whenever you require to export a large amount of data or to take a backup of your data without big impact on your API limits.  
This is an asynchronous API, meaning that the response of your request is not available immediately. You will be notified to the callback URL when the data is ready to download or you can choose to check the job status periodically. Click [here](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v4/bulk-read/overview.html) to know more about Bulk Read APIs.

tags.name: Bulk Write
tags.description:
Bulk Write API allows you to insert, update, or upsert a large set of data. This is an asynchronous API, meaning that the response of your request is not available immediately. When the records are processed, the system notifies you of job completion in the callback URL or you can check the job status periodically.  
This API allows you to insert, update, or upsert a maximum of **25000** records in a single API call. Click [here](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v4/bulk-write/overview.html) to know more about the Bulk Write APIs.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: Notification APIs allow you to get instant notifications whenever an action is performed on the records of a module. The system notifies you of the event on the URL provided.Click [here](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v4/notifications/overview.html) to know more about the Notifications API.

tags.name: Query
tags.description: CRM Object Query Language (COQL) is a query language based on the SQL syntax. It helps the users write their own queries to get records from Zoho CRM by using **field API names** instead of column names and **module API names** instead of table names. Click [here](https://www.zoho.com/crm/developer/docs/api/v4/COQL-Overview.html) to know more about the Query API.
